metadata.synopsis: During the battle for New France, a man (David La Haye) falls in love with a young widow (Noémie Godin-Vigneau) suspected of witchcraft.

reviews: While the love story is nothing special, Battle of the Brave is worth one look for people who enjoy the period.
you'll be dying for Celine Dion's inevitable closing number to take you away from it all. God, never thought I'd say that.
History is long, life is short. It's certainly too short for the sort of overblown, melodramatic, pseudo-epic filmmaking Quebec's Jean Beaudin tried to foist on Francophone audiences two years ago.
Feels like a French Romantic novel shot without a trace of irony.
Fans the flames of passion, undoused by time or clunky exposition.
